intro: Allophylus dasystachys, commonly known as the large-stemmed holly, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
